author: bridge-bot
content:
<minhhn2910> I tried to use for a contract like this : 
```
pragma solidity ^0.8.0;
contract Branching {
    function test(uint input) public payable{
        require (input*2 == 8888888888 && msg.value  == 12345);
        payable(msg.sender).transfer(1 ether);
    }
}
```

author: bridge-bot
content:
<minhhn2910> after I filtered out some of the input data (about 3 of them) that cannot be decoded using ABI, the generated examples are nice:
('test', input: [57896051520404547748118623579231443086240510726840930619147342726630526207752], value: 0)
('test', input: [4444444444], value: 0)
('test', input: [4444444444], value: 12345)
('test', input: [4444444572], value: 0)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<minhhn2910> Ok, one more question :) . What is the recommended number for `--max-iterations`? 
I tried `--get-models` on one complex contract. If I dont set `--max-iterations`: the tool freezes if I use 'cvc4' regardless of smttimeout: i set `--smttimeout 1 `
Looks like the `--smttimeout` doesnt work on `cvc4` ?

author: bridge-bot
content: <xvwx:matrix.dapp.org.uk> you will need `--max-iterations` for anything that loops

author: bridge-bot
content: <xvwx:matrix.dapp.org.uk> or loops in an unbounded way

author: bridge-bot
content: <xvwx:matrix.dapp.org.uk> this can include very simple stuff (e.g. solidity will insert loops if you read a string from storage)

author: bridge-bot
content:

https://github.com/ethereum/hevm/issues/105
https://github.com/ethereum/hevm/issues/112
